column4: Where is the »kerneloops« service described? '~$ rgrep 'kerneloops' /usr/src/linux-source-2.6.38/Documentation/ 2>dev/null' does not produce any output.
So where'd you find the 2.6.38 stuff? :-)
I will answer your question after you have answered my question.
There isn't a kerneloops service in stock kernels; it's a debugging thing, not really something you'd want turned on for production releases.
I see. Thank you for explaining. I inadvertently put my question here in this channel but should have rather put it in #ubuntu+1. linux-source-2.6.38 is provided by Natty.
Any chance it's running without bonding to your current terminal?
After this operation you can restart GNOME in the usual way. For example: sudo service gem stop && sudo service gdm restart.
After this operation you can restart GNOME in the usual way. For example: sudo service gdm stop && sudo service gdm restart.
I didn't have a question, so why are you telling me this? :)
I Think that this was a hacker's attack.
